data.title: Famous Birthdays on May 16
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays for the 16th of May. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals were born on May 16.
data.text:
Birthdays 1 - 200 of 235

Everard Digby, English conspirator (d. 1606)

Infante Ferdinand

Governor of the Spanish Netherlands, Cardinal of the Holy Catholic Church and military commander during the Thirty Years' War, born in San Lorenzo de El Escorial, Spain

Innocent XI [Benedetto Odescalchi], Italian, 240th Pope (1676-89), born in Como (d. 1689)

Dudley North, English financier and economist (wrote work advocating for free-trade), born in Westminster, England (d. 1691)

Campegius Vitringa, Dutch theologian (wrote work on prophetic theology - Anacrisis Apocalypseos Joannis Apostoli), born in Leeuwarden, Dutch Republic (d. 1722)

William Talbot, 1st Earl Talbot, English politician (d. 1782)

Maria Gaetana Agnesi, Italian mathematician (d. 1799)

Antonius van Alphen, Dutch apostolic vicar of De Bosch (d. 1831)

John Opie, English painter, born in Trevellas, Cornwall (d. 1807)

Louis-Nicolas Vauquelin, French chemist and pharmacist (discovered chromium, beryllium), born in t Saint-André-d'Hébertot, France (d. 1829)

John Sell Cotman, English water color artist, born in Norwich, England (d. 1842)

Friedrich Rückert, German Poet, Translator and Orientalist (d. 1866)

William H. Seward

American politician (Secretary of State, 1861-69, Governor of New York, 1839-42), born in Florida, New York

Elizabeth Palmer Peabody, American educator, founder of first English-language kindergarten in the US, born in Billerica, Massachusetts (d. 1894)

George C. Cadwalader, American Major General (Union Army), born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (d. 1879)

Henry Hopkins Sibley, Brigadier General (Confederate Army), (d. 1886)

Daniel Ammen, Capt (Union Navy), (d. 1898)

Pafnuty Chebyshev, Russian mathematician (d. 1894)

Eduard Hille, German composer and conductor, born in Wahlhauſen, Kingdom of Hanover (d. 1891)

Edmund Kirby Smith, American military officer (Confederate Army General), born in St Augustine, Florida (d. 1893)

1824 Levi Parsons Morton, American ambassador and politician (R) (Vice President of the United States 1889-93, Governor of New York 1895-96), born in Shoreham, New York (d. 1920) [1]

P.J.H. [Pierre] Cuypers, Dutch architect (Amsterdam Museum, Central station), born in Roermond, the Netherlands (d. 1921)

David Edward Hughes

British-American inventor (microphone, teleprinter), born in either London, England or Corwen, Wales

Philip Danforth Armour, American industrialist (foundered meatpacking firm Armour Foods), born in Stockbridge, New York (d. 1901)

Arthur Henry Mann, English organist and composer (Kings College Cambridge, Church of England Hymnal), born in Norwich, England (d. 1929)

1858 Hanus Trnecek, Czech composer and conductor, born in PraguePrague, Kingdom of Bohemia (d. 1914)

American serial killer associated with 27 deaths, born in Gilmanton, New Hampshire

Nathan Birnbaum, Austrian writer (Gottes Volk; Der Ruf), and philosopher (early Zionist, later anti-Zionist), born in Vienna, Austrian Empire (d. 1937)

David Werner Amram, American lawyer, legal and Talmudic scholar, Zionist, and author (The Makers of Hebrew Books in Italy), born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (d. 1939)

1866 Ernest Burgess, American urban sociologist (ecological school), born in Tilbury, Ontario (d. 1966)

Taylor Holmes, American actor (Sleeping Beauty, Gentlemen Prefer Blondes), born in Newark, New Jersey (d. 1959)

Julius Tannen, American vaudeville comedian (Great Moment), born in Manhattan, New York (d. 1965)

1887 Jakob van Hoddis [Hans Davidsohn], German Jewish poet (d. 1942?)

Joan Collette, Dutch graphic artist and painter (New Church, Delft), born in Delft, Netherlands (d. 1958)

Richard Tauber [Denemy], Austrian-British operatic tenor and film actor, born in Linz, Austria (d. 1948)

1893 Paul Amadeus Pisk, Austrian-American composer, musicologist, and educator, born in Vienna, Austria (d. 1990)

Tamara de Lempicka, Polish-born painter (d. 1980)

Hugh Plaxton, Canadian ice hockey left wing (Olympic gold 1928; Montreal Maroons) and politician (House of Commons of Canada 1935-40), born in Barrie, Ontario (d. 1982)

H. E. Bates [Herbert Ernest Bates ], English writer (Love for Lydia, The Darling Buds of May), born in Rusden, England (d. 1974)

Henry Fonda

American stage and screen actor (Mr. Roberts; 12 Angry Men; On Golden Pond), born in Grand Island, Nebraska

Alfred Pellan, French Canadian painter (d. 1988)
